intro: Lapsana communis subsp. pisidica, commonly known as the lesser hawk's-beard, is a herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–80 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its bright yellow flowers appear in clusters, and it produces small, oval-shaped seeds. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas.
